Accounting chronicles of the XXI century: IP-Schnick on USNO 6% and a letter from the tax
04 Nov 2019, 10:11 by Accounting Ada listens



Another sad story. An IP-employee at USNO 6%, registered last summer, receives a letter from the tax.
For 2017, you passed the declaration on the simplified tax system 6%. But in vain! You had to first apply for the use of the simplified tax system, you did not file it. Therefore, hand over the reports on the OSNO for 2017 and 2018 and pay taxes of about 17 lyam. We have already calculated everything. And fines with penalties. On a voluntary basis.ü§∑ü§∑ü§∑
I watch the chief accountant of phenazepam with cognac drinks. Or brandy phenazepam snack. Well, not the point, I understand that you won‚Äôt be able to talk to her. I go to the IP-shnik himself. He is also "neither mu nor oink." Okay, who registered the IP? Law Firm. Well, there is already hope. Where are the registration documents? Dragged. There is naturally no notice of the transition to the simplified tax system. I ask, were there any more papers? No. Like. I do not remember.
Ufff ...
I‚Äôll look at the USRIP, just in case. And there is a shit - in the list of documents accepted during registration, an application for the simplified tax system!
I am writing an answer to the tax as a Cossack to the Turkish Sultan: you have a statement on the simplified tax system, and you submitted it to the USRIP. What are 17 lyamas?
Half an hour business.
I observe this situation repeatedly. Most likely the tax authorities have such a training manual. I‚Äôll run into a hundred IPshniks, most likely I‚Äôve lost half a piece of paper and someone will be able to rip off money.
It turns out:
The tax side may have claims, for example, to the applicable tax system. For example, if the IFTS received advance payments under the simplified tax system or a tax return, then it is required to check whether the taxpayer is eligible to apply this special regime. If this did not happen, then the inspectorate does not have the right to bring claims to the taxpayer related to the unlawful application of the simplified tax system (determination of the Judicial Board for Economic Disputes of the Supreme Court of the Russian Federation of 02.07.2019 No. 310-ES19-1705 in case No. A62-5153 / 2017).
